definitions: the quality of being able to be persuaded to act dishonestly or immorally for personal gain

examples.text: a cynical view of the corruptibility of human nature
times of great idealism carry equal chances for great corruptibility

shortDefinitions: quality of being able to be persuaded to act dishonestly or immorally for personal gain

definitions: ability to be changed or debased through errors or unintentional alterations

examples.text: writers warn us about the corruptibility of language in the wrong hands

shortDefinitions: ability to be changed or debased through errors or unintentional alterations
